oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Chippings of Gemsbok, Quagga, Ostriches, etc., executed by Xaa-ttin (father of the informant), to be found at the place (not yet identified) called !kann, where these animals used formerly to come to drink. In English, after Dia!kwain (L V.-24. 5963 rev., note). About the chippings made by Dia!kwain's father Xaa-ttin before the Dutch ('Boers') came. The chippings depict various game animals near to where the animals used to drink. 1) See also Words and sentences (and Dia!kwain's father's drawings), 2) This story is found in Book V-24.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Chippings made by Dia!kwain's father (before the time of the 'Boers')
